alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lee; Pontotoc (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Calhoun, Pontotoc and southwestern Lee Counties through 230 PM CDT... At 200 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Randolph, or 13 miles southwest of Pontotoc, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tupelo, Pontotoc, Trace State Park, Troy, Furrs, Randolph, Sherman, Algoma, Nixon, Robbs, Endville, Chiwapa, Palmetto, Pannell, Chesterville, Matthews, Rough Edge, Wallfield and George P Cossar State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
